etymology.description: 告(announce) + 别(separate/part) = announce separation → farewell.
etymology.interpretation: Announces a parting, often with a formal or emotional tone. Common in both everyday goodbyes and ceremonial farewells.
etymology.simplification: 別 → 别 adopts an older shorthand/variant that merges/simplifies the 刂 component, reducing strokes for easier writing; 告 unchanged.

parts.english: to tell; to inform; to announce; to sue/accuse
to part/separate; to distinguish; other; don't (imperative)

examples.chinese: 我们在车站挥手告别(我們在車站揮手告別)。
examples.english: We waved goodbye at the station.

examples.chinese: 临行前，他向老师郑重告别(臨行前，他向老師鄭重告別)。
examples.pinyin: Línxíng qián, tā xiàng lǎoshī zhèngzhòng gàobié.
examples.english: Before departing, he formally bid farewell to his teacher.

examples.chinese: 这次告别不是终点，而是新的开始(這次告別不是終點，而是新的開始)。
examples.pinyin: Zhè cì gàobié bú shì zhōngdiǎn, ér shì xīn de kāishǐ.
examples.english: This farewell is not the end, but a new beginning.
